newsitem.title: MEXICO: GFInver plunges on Santander takeover news. [CORRECTED 00:54 GMT 25/10]
newsitem.headline: GFInver plunges on Santander takeover news. [CORRECTED 00:54 GMT 25/10]

text.p: Troubled Mexican bank Grupo Financiero Invermexico (GFInver) shares plunged at midsession on Thursday in Mexico after news confirming Spain's Banco Santander would take it over, traders said.
"They've got what they wanted, a 'mestizo' (mixed Indian and Spanish) bank. Dealers bought on the rumor and now they're selling on the news," said a floor trader.
"They're selling, but you can't go too far. People are a little unsure over the details of the deal," he added.
GFInver LCP, BCP, CCP and ACP shares led the percentage loss leaders in late trade, down 20, 22, 16 and 10 centavos, respectively, to 80 and 97 centavos, 1.00 pesos and 88 centavos.

Mexico's National Banking and Securities Commission announced on Thursday that Banco Santander will add $378.5 million in fresh capital to Banco Mexicano and take control of the financial group at the beginning of next year.
Santander said in a separate announcement that it would add $378.5 million (corrects from $371.75 million) to the troubled Mexican bank.
"Dealers think that the share price will end up at 80 centavos," another trader said.
"It remains to be seen how the takeover is managed and the bank is capitalized, but they're selling right away," he added.
